result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Delando Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon Delando Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Devon Delando Johnson.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Devon Delando Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Defendant has a pending felony before Branch 4.  Branch 40 accepts transfer of case # 22CF123 for possible global resolution.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Devon Delando Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Defense requests a status date. Court set matter as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Devon Delando Johnson not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon Delando Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of West Allis Police Officer Kyle Brockmann.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in court (via zoom) with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon Delando Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case in court for motion hearing.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense's motion to dismiss. Case adjourned for prelim hearing in prelim court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Supplement to Defense's Motion to Dismiss.
Received and Filed:  Defense's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Due to Failure to Properly Extend Preliminary Hearing for Cause.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Devon Delando Johnson not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. Defendant was moved from Milwaukee County to Dodge County prior to hearing. Court unable to set up zoom hearing due to Dodge County having no availability for zoom. Court finds CAUSE to extend time limits for prelim for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises would like to proceed pro se with motion to dismiss and be represented after. Defense advises has not reviewed motion to dismiss since pro se motion was filed. Court sets case for motion hearing for defense to review motion to dismiss. Court will address pro se motion if motion to dismiss can not be addressed at next hearing. Court finds cause to continue to extend prelim time limits. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant would like to represent himself. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for the Judge to determine if the defendant is able to proceed pro-se.  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed: Defendant's pro-se motion to dismiss.
Return address: 
Devon Johnson 
8885 S 68th
Franklin, WI 53132

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD to appoint Attorney Hotchkiss pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Devon Delando Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devon Delando Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
